p: A clinical deterioration is seen in severe cases of dengue virus infection, including increased hematocrit and thrombocytopenia, increased vascular permeability and bleedings. The laboratory analyses demonstrated that the increased serum hyaluronan levels ( Fig. 1 b) correlated to increased hematocrit ( Fig. 1 c) and low platelet counts ( Fig. 1 d); the former two increased significantly during day 4–5 and then declined during day 8–10, whereas the platelet counts declined significantly during day 4–5 and then increased during day 8–10.
